intro: Daviesia asperula subsp. obliqua, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daviesia, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers during the autumn season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in native gardens.
